column5: Just curious about whether the fishing is slow everywhere or just where I'm fishing right now (Wpg. river near Mb./On. border). Usually most of september remains excellent where I'm at, but the fall bite never seemed to turn on. Anybody else on the river or elsewhere experiencing this? If so, is anybody having success with non-typical methods?

[font color=green size=3][b]Last week I was fishing lakes in the Perrault Falls area, the weather was great and the Walleyes were biting in their summer paterns. We did better than I would have expected.

Tuesday night in the midst of a nice storm I caught two ( 9 lbs and 12.3 lbs) from my favourite shore spot. They are not as fat as this time last year. The salmon are late, too, though.The whole season has been about 3 weeks behind scheddule.
